חדשות המדע https://www.sciencenews.org עיתונאות עצמאית מאז 1921 שני, 16 בדצמבר 2024 20:37:36 +0000 en-US מדי שעה 1 https://wordpress.org/?v=6.7.1 165798862
שעוות אוזניים של כבשים עלולה לרשום דיאטה מסוכנת https://www.sciencenews.org/article/sheep-earwax-record-dangerous-dietJake Buehler Tue, 17 Dec 2024 14:00:00 +0000Life https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3147471 Sheep that eat death camas plants record the toxic meal in their earwax, a goopy health data repository that researchers are increasingly exploring. 3147471
הנה 8 ראשונות מדעיות יוצאות דופן של 2024 https://www.sciencenews.org/article/remarkable-scientific-firsts-of-2024Sophie Hartley Mon, 16 Dec 2024 18:00:00 +0000Life https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3147303 Making panda stem cells, mapping a fruit fly’s brain and witnessing a black hole wake up were among the biggest achievements of the year. 3147303
חלק שולח ההודעות של נוירונים עשוי להיות בולבי, לא חלק https://www.sciencenews.org/article/axons-may-be-blobby-neuronLaura Sanders Mon, 16 Dec 2024 14:00:00 +0000Neuroscience https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3147377 Axons can be shaped like strings of pearls, research in mice and people show. How that shape may influence brain signaling is not yet clear. 3147377
ייתכן שהטבח העתיק הגדול ביותר בבריטניה כלל קניבליזם https://www.sciencenews.org/article/britain-ancient-massacre-cannibalismBruce Bower Mon, 16 Dec 2024 00:01:00 +0000Anthropology https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3147569 Bones recovered from a natural shaft unveil a 4,000-year-old massacre of men, women and children, possibly part of a cycle of revenge killings. 3147569
התגליות הללו בשנת 2024 יכולות להיות פורצות דרך - אם הן נכונות https://www.sciencenews.org/article/2024-science-discoveries-could-be-trueMaria Temming Fri, 13 Dec 2024 20:00:00 +0000Space https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3147311 Did microbes ever live on Mars? Did an "elevator" help build Egypt’s first pyramid? Some signs pointed to yes this year, but confirmation is still needed. 3147311
בדיקת סרטן והפסקת עישון הצילו כמעט 6 מיליון חיים https://www.sciencenews.org/article/cancer-screening-save-6-million-livesTina Hesman Saey Fri, 13 Dec 2024 18:00:00 +0000Health & Medicine https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3147336 Prevention, screening and treatment advances combined stopped 5.94 million deaths from cancer in the United States from 1975 through 2020. 3147336
בני אדם קישרו רגשות לאותם חלקי גוף במשך 3,000 שנה https://www.sciencenews.org/article/link-emotions-body-parts-3000-yearsJason Bittel Fri, 13 Dec 2024 16:00:00 +0000Anthropology https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3147363 3,000-year-old clay tablets show that some associations between emotion and parts of the body have remained the same for millennia. 3147363
הליקוי של 2024 נתן מראה נדיר של השמש. הנה הצצה לנתונים מוקדמים https://www.sciencenews.org/article/2024-eclipse-sun-early-data-coronaCarolyn Gramling Fri, 13 Dec 2024 14:00:00 +0000Space https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3147501 Teams are starting to analyze data from the total solar eclipse to learn more about the sun’s corona, gravity waves and changes in Earth’s ionosphere. 3147501
הרובר Perseverance של נאס"א מצא תפאורה פוטנציאלית חדשה לחיי מאדים https://www.sciencenews.org/article/nasa-perseverance-rover-potential-life-settingNikk Ogasa Thu, 12 Dec 2024 22:39:47 +0000Planetary Science https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3147532 Now atop Jezero Crater, the robotic explorer found quartz indicative of habitable environments and possibly the oldest rocks yet seen in the solar system. 3147532
ה'בלוב', גל חום ימי חסר תקדים, הרג 4 מיליון עופות ים https://www.sciencenews.org/article/blob-marine-heat-wave-killed-seabirdsJake Buehler Thu, 12 Dec 2024 19:04:55 +0000Life https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3147521 Millions of other animals may have perished too, suggesting the die-off event might be one of the worst in modern times. 3147521
הגנים הניאנדרטליים באנשים היום הגיעו מחיבורים לפני כ-47,000 שנה https://www.sciencenews.org/article/neandertal-mate-people-47000-years-agoMcKenzie Prillaman Thu, 12 Dec 2024 19:00:00 +0000Genetics https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3147504 Most present-day humans carry a small amount of Neandertal DNA that can be traced back to a single period of interbreeding, two genetic analyses find. 3147504
